title: Focus Relationship in Plate Angle Configuration A
description: Determine the relative focal lengths for Configuration A.
insight: Configuration A creates astigmatism with different vertical and horizontal focus distances.
question_text: In a phase conjugate holographic system where the object beam is normal to the plate and the reference beam is at an angle (Configuration A from pg 135), how does the vertical focus distance compare to the horizontal focus distance?

solution.final_answer: Vertical focus distance is longer than horizontal focus distance.
steps: 1. Configuration A positions object/reference beams asymmetrically
2. This creates astigmatism in the reconstructed image
3. Vertical focus forms farther from the plate than horizontal focus

title: Focus Relationship in Plate Angle Configuration B
description: Determine the relative focal lengths for Configuration B.
insight: Configuration B eliminates astigmatism through symmetric beam geometry.
question_text: In a phase conjugate holographic system where the plate bisects the object and reference beams (plate angle Configuration B from pg 135), how does the vertical focus distance compare to the horizontal focus distance?

solution.final_answer: Vertical and horizontal focus distances are **equal**.
steps: 1. Configuration B uses symmetric beam placement
3. Both foci converge at identical distances from plate

title: Focus Relationship in Plate Angle Configuration C
description: Determine the relative focal lengths for Configuration C.
insight: Configuration C creates compressed vertical focus through orthogonal beam alignment.
question_text: In a phase conjugate holographic system where the reference beam is normal to the plate and the object beam is at an angle (Configuration C from pg 135), how does the vertical focus distance compare to the horizontal focus distance?

solution.final_answer: Vertical focus distance is shorter than horizontal focus distance.
steps: 1. Configuration C uses orthogonal beam alignment
3. Vertical focus forms closer to plate than horizontal focus
